title: Police pay damages to family of gangster Mark Duggan
text:
Scotland Yard has paid damages to the family of Mark Duggan, who was shot dead by officers in 2011, sparking widespread civil unrest.

The family launched a civil action against the Met earlier this year and the Force was understood to be defending the claim.

However at a short hearing at the High Court in London on Thursday morning, it was confirmed that the family had accepted a confidential settlement.

It is understood the settlement involved a five figure sum.

Mr Duggan, 29, was shot dead in Tottenham in August 2011 by armed police who believed he was carrying a gun and posed a threat.

An inquest heard how marksmen had intercepted a minicab Mr Duggan was travelling in after intelligence indicated he was part of a gang and had arranged to collect a gun.

The jury found that Mr Duggan was not holding the weapon when he was shot, but concluded that he had been lawfully killed.

Mr Duggan's family challenged the lawful killing conclusion, but the High Court and the Court of Appeal ruled against them.

The UK Supreme Court declined to hear the case and they have lodged an appeal with the European Court of Human Rights.
description: Scotland Yard has paid damages to the family of Mark Duggan, who was shot dead by officers in 2011, sparking widespread civil unrest.
